mFISHx-y6.memHandModelNotes: Optimal conditions: forest tracts of 245 acres (99ha) or more, interconnected with other large areas of suitable habitat; a dense understory of young conifers, shrubs, and herbaceous cover is important in summer.  From NatureServe 2005.  ****Non-Contiguous Patch usage??. Amy Silvano 24jun05

habitat_description: M. pennant inhabits coniferous or mixed forests, with high canopy cover (>50%), avoiding open areas, scrub, and hardwood forests. Forest structure is a more powerful indicator of fisher presence than is composition, with snag and stump abundance, coarse woody debris, large diameter trees, and a diversity of tree diameters all positively correlated with fisher use.
